revision.comment: Notification of altered sources needing review #IABot
revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject ACC|class=C|importance=high}} {{WikiProject College basketball|class=C|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Syracuse, New York|class=C|importance=high}} {{WikiProject New York|class=C|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Sports|class=C|importance=Mid}} }} ==Fair use rationale for Image:Ch-otto.jpg== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|70px|left]] '''[[:Image:Ch-otto.jpg]]''' is being used on this article. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is no [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline|explanation or rationale]] as to why its use in Wikipedia articles constitutes fair use. In addition to the [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/Fair use|boilerplate fair use template]], you must also write out on the image description page a specific explanation or rationale for why using this image in each article is consistent with [[WP:FU|fair use]]. Please go to [[:Image:Ch-otto.jpg|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline |fair use rationale]]. Using one of the templates at [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline]] is an easy way to insure that your image is in compliance with Wikipedia policy, but remember that you must complete the template. Do not simply insert a blank template on an image page. If there is other other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on the other images used on this page. Note that any fair use images uploaded after 4 May, 2006, and lacking such an explanation will be deleted one week after they have been uploaded, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you.[[User:BetacommandBot|BetacommandBot]] 05:19, 2 June 2007 (UTC) ==Fair use rationale for Image:Edavis.gif== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|70px|left]] '''[[:Image:Edavis.gif]]''' is being used on this article. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is no [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline|explanation or rationale]] as to why its use in Wikipedia articles constitutes fair use. In addition to the [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/Fair use|boilerplate fair use template]], you must also write out on the image description page a specific explanation or rationale for why using this image in each article is consistent with [[WP:FU|fair use]]. Please go to [[:Image:Edavis.gif|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline |fair use rationale]]. Using one of the templates at [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline]] is an easy way to insure that your image is in compliance with Wikipedia policy, but remember that you must complete the template. Do not simply insert a blank template on an image page. If there is other other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on the other images used on this page. Note that any fair use images uploaded after 4 May, 2006, and lacking such an explanation will be deleted one week after they have been uploaded, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you.[[User:BetacommandBot|BetacommandBot]] 02:38, 3 June 2007 (UTC) ==Fair use rationale for Image:Su logo.jpg== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|70px|left]] '''[[:Image:Su logo.jpg]]''' is being used on this article. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is no [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline|explanation or rationale]] as to why its use in '''this''' Wikipedia article constitutes fair use. In addition to the [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/Fair use|boilerplate fair use template]], you must also write out on the image description page a specific explanation or rationale for why using this image in each article is consistent with [[WP:FU|fair use]]. Please go to [[:Image:Su logo.jpg|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline |fair use rationale]]. Using one of the templates at [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline]] is an easy way to insure that your image is in compliance with Wikipedia policy, but remember that you must complete the template. Do not simply insert a blank template on an image page. If there is other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on the other images used on this page. Note that any fair use images uploaded after 4 May, 2006, and lacking such an explanation will be deleted one week after they have been uploaded, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. [[User:BetacommandBot|BetacommandBot]] 05:07, 3 July 2007 (UTC) == Color(s?) == I was under the impression that only orange was an official color - blue is an unofficial secondary color. Why are both listed? - [[User:Plasticbadge|Plasticbadge]] 23:49, 22 October 2007 (UTC) As is usually the case with the waste of bandwidth known as wikipedia, they have it WRONG. Orange is the ONLY "official color", and the original "Orangeman" name WAS from the Irish Proddy fraternity, NOT the color Orange. I do not correct Wipikipedia erros, in the hopes that the failed experiment in empowering ignorant angry loners with faux influnence, will implode into it's own stupidity. == Need photo of Saltine Warrior == Need photo of the Saltine Warrior. [[User:Badagnani|Badagnani]] ([[User talk:Badagnani|talk]]) 23:08, 17 April 2008 (UTC) == Dwight Freeney == Hope nobody minds but I added him to the players list last week. I can't believe he wasn't on there to begin with and I thought he should definitely be added on there with his accomplishments. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/141.238.98.77|141.238.98.77]] ([[User talk:141.238.98.77|talk]]) 04:01, 18 September 2008 (UTC) ==Dave Meggyesy== I added a link to the [[Dave Meggyesy]] article that I just started. I can find lots about his book and the related controversy, but almost nothing about his college and NFL careers. The pro football databases do not have defensive statistics for the 1960s, except for the number of games played. There are a couple of Google News hits that say he was an All-American at Syracuse, but I'd have to pay for an article in order to see the details--such as whose list he was on. If anybody has access to sources of Meggyesy's performance at St. Louis or at Syracuse, please add it to the infobox or start a new section. The article still seems stubbish for NFL and college football projects.--[[User:Hjal|Hjal]] ([[User talk:Hjal|talk]]) 05:14, 12 November 2008 (UTC) ==Split football section into own article?== Most other major universities with a football team have separate articles for their team. Should the football history section be split into its own article? [[User:Cardsplayer4life|Cardsplayer4life]] ([[User talk:Cardsplayer4life|talk]]) 06:20, 30 November 2008 (UTC) :Sure. I split the basketball team into it's own page. I've been waiting for someone to do the same with football... Good luck. [[User:GoCuse44|GoCuse44]] ([[User talk:GoCuse44|talk]]) 17:09, 30 November 2008 (UTC) ::Seconding 44's comments. If you need any assistance, feel free to contact me. [[User:Darry2385|Darry2385]] ([[User talk:Darry2385|talk]]) 17:59, 12 December 2008 (UTC) ::Indeed, it should be - almost all BCS Conference schools have their football teams with their own article. The only exceptions are Syracuse, Cincinnati, and Connecticut. This ought to be rectified. [[User:John Kenney|john k]] ([[User talk:John Kenney|talk]]) 15:05, 16 December 2008 (UTC) ::: If Cards4life doesn't do it, I'll take care of it at the end of December. [[User:GoCuse44|GoCuse44]] ([[User talk:GoCuse44|talk]]) 04:30, 18 December 2008 (UTC) ::::I have finals and then will be busy for Christmas activities. But if you want some assistance, 44, let me know. -[[User:Darry2385|Darry2385]] ([[User talk:Darry2385|talk]]) 13:19, 18 December 2008 (UTC) :::::I split it off into its own article at [[Syracuse Orange football]]. Not being very familiar with the university, I did the best that I could, but it needs quite a lot of work to make it better. (lots more info could be filled in on the infobox to start) Hopefully it is an alright rough place to start from for you guys. The addition of a section on rivalries (if there are any for Syracuse), coaching history (maybe a chart or something of all the coaches), more information on football-related facilities, and information on any awards and highlights of the team (All American awards, coaching awards, bowl appearances, Heismans, etc.) might be good things to think about adding. Also, I was wondering if it would be good to add the football team to the [[Template:Syracuse University|Syracuse University navigational template]]? (along with the basketball article) [[User:Cardsplayer4life|Cardsplayer4life]] ([[User talk:Cardsplayer4life|talk]]) 02:40, 22 December 2008 (UTC) ::::::Looks good. I'm sure as time goes on, we'll all take turns adding on. Thanks. [[User:GoCuse44|GoCuse44]] ([[User talk:GoCuse44|talk]]) 02:56, 22 December 2008 (UTC) == Sourcing tag == I think this article could use some [[WP:RS|better sourcing]]. [[User:Bearian|Bearian]] ([[User talk:Bearian|talk]]) 21:16, 6 February 2012 (UTC) == Just sport? == Any user notice that more than nine-tenths of this article is dedicated to athletics? There is very little academic content about Syracuse University on this Wiki article. [[User:Snowfalcon cu|Snowfalcon cu]] ([[User talk:Snowfalcon cu|talk]]) 20:51, 19 November 2013 (UTC) That's because this is about the athletic program at this school, not about the school I general. [[User:Wschart|Wschart]] ([[User talk:Wschart|talk]]) 16:38, 16 March 2014 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:4|one external link|4 external links}} on [[Syracuse Orange]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=699092189 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20071203075451/http://media.www.dailyorange.com/media/storage/paper522/news/2004/04/16/Sports/Matt-Cappelli.Never.Let.Being.4Foot4.Get.In.His.Way-662670.shtml to http://media.www.dailyorange.com/media/storage/paper522/news/2004/04/16/Sports/Matt-Cappelli.Never.Let.Being.4Foot4.Get.In.His.Way-662670.shtml *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20081020093352/http://syracuse.edu:80/aboutsu/chronology/1870.html to http://www.syracuse.edu/aboutsu/chronology/1870.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20081007204747/http://dartreview.com/archives/2004/06/01/the_week_in_review.php to http://dartreview.com/archives/2004/06/01/the_week_in_review.php *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090211051311/http://www.syracuse.edu:80/aboutsu/chronology/1931.html to http://www.syracuse.edu/aboutsu/chronology/1931.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 05:18, 10 January 2016 (UTC) :The two archived links to the DailyOrange and the DartReview are correct. [[User:Jeff in CA|Jeff in CA]] ([[User talk:Jeff in CA|talk]]) 18:14, 10 January 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:2|one external link|2 external links}} on [[Syracuse Orange]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=707461462 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive http://web.archive.org/web/20081107025236/http://syracuse.edu:80/aboutsu/memorabilia/mascot.html to http://www.syracuse.edu/aboutsu/memorabilia/mascot.html *Added archive http://web.archive.org/web/20071203071819/http://media.www.dailyorange.com/media/storage/paper522/news/2007/04/02/Opinion/Letter.To.The.Editor.otto.The.Orange.Coined.In.1992-2816913.shtml to http://media.www.dailyorange.com/media/storage/paper522/news/2007/04/02/Opinion/Letter.To.The.Editor.otto.The.Orange.Coined.In.1992-2816913.shtml When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 00:44, 29 February 2016 (UTC)
